intro: Lophiolepis heldreichii subsp. heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan rockrose, is a member of the Geraniaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is native to the Balkan Peninsula. Its botanical features make it well adapted to Mediterranean and temperate climates.
